H0.text: Solar energy is the alternative energy resource that changes part of a river into a lake.

H1.text: Geothermal energy, an alternative energy resource, changes part of a river into a lake.

H2.text: Hydropower changes part of a river into a lake.

H3.text: Biofuel energy changes part of a river into a lake.

A4.text: Large reservoirs associated with traditional hydroelectric power stations result in submersion of extensive areas upstream of the dams, sometimes destroying biologically rich and productive lowland and riverine valley forests, marshland and grasslands.

A5.text: Reservoirs created by hydroelectric schemes often provide facilities for water sports, and become tourist attractions themselves.
